description: From belly +‎ band. As a Japanese article of clothing, a calque of Japanese 腹巻き (haramaki).

entries.meaning: (equestrianism) A strap around the belly of a horse or other draft animal used to secure a saddle or the shafts of a cart.

definitionGroups.group: (fashion, medicine) Various constrictive bands worn around the belly, particularly:

entries.meaning: A band worn by expectant mothers to constrict and support the fetus.
A band worn by babies to protect the navel.
A haramaki: a band of cloth worn around the abdomen to preserve stomach qi and boost circulation.
(nautical) A band of canvas used to strengthen a sail.
A type of dust jacket that covers only a portion of a book.
